alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 4:20AM AKDT until September 30 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Mendenhall Valley and Auke Lake in Juneau. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low lying areas near Auke Lake is occurring. Minor flooding around Mendenhall Lake and River is expected Tuesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 AM AKDT, Minor flooding continues to be observed. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches are possible through Tuesday afternoon. - For Auke Lake near Auke Bay: At 4:00 am the stage was 33.18 feet and holding steady. Flood Stage is 33.0 feet. Impacts: At 33.0 feet: Water from the lake will inundate yards of homes along Auke Lake. For Montana Creek at Back Loop Bridge: At 4:00 am the stage was 14.3 feet and falling. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Forecast: The creek crested around 15.8 feet around 8 pm Monday. The creek is currently below bankfull stage and continuing to drop. For Mendenhall Lake : At 4:15am the stage was 8.4 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.71 feet is expected around 4:00pm Tuesday. Impacts: At 7.7 feet: Nugget Falls trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail. Along the Mendenhall River some sections will experience bank erosion resulting in dangerous tree fall. These conditions could make floating the river more hazardous with the higher water levels. At 9.0 feet: Water covers Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead, also water will flow into the Mendenhall Lake Campground. At 9.4 feet: The yards along View Drive will start to flood and cause minor flooding. At 9.6 feet: There will be 7 inches of water over the Skaters Cabin Road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier Trailhead. Campsite 7 will be flooded as well as water flowing over the road between campsites 8 and 9 in the Mendenhall campground. - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible. - The ongoing rains could swamp boats. Mariners should check their vessels immediately. - All residents on or near mountain slopes should be prepared for possible landslides.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
